meanings.definition: To compete against (someone) in a match that was previously played
meanings.sent1: After losing the first game, they rematched to see who would win.
meanings.sent2: The two friends rematched in a friendly game of chess.
meanings.sent3: The siblings rematched in a game of tag, determined to win this time.
meanings.sent4: The two rivals rematched on the tennis court, each seeking victory.
meanings.sent5: The teams rematched in the championship, eager to prove themselves.

meanings.definition: To arrange for (two people or teams) to compete against each other in a match that was previously played
meanings.sent1: The coach rematched the top players for a final showdown.
meanings.sent2: She rematched the teams for a thrilling soccer match.
meanings.sent3: The teacher rematched the students in a spelling bee for fun.
meanings.sent4: The event planner rematched the contestants for an exciting rematch.
meanings.sent5: He rematched the chess champions for a highly anticipated game.
